newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin makes it simple for Moscow schoolkids.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin makes it simple for Moscow schoolkids.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin kissed a fluffy toy rabbit he received as a gift after presenting a simplified version of his policies to Moscow school children on Friday .

"If the economy and the financial sphere start growing, education will also get a big boost. I personally monitor the questions of education and I look into its future with optimism," Yeltsin told the children.
Russia is fighting a severe budget crisis but the government has said the economy is starting to grow slowly.
Education is one of the worst hit sectors, with hundreds of thousands of teachers living on low salaries that are often not paid for months on end.
Yeltsin also mentioned his new anti-corruption drive during his improvised speech at the secondary school where his granddaughter Masha is studying.
He said no government officials would escape having to declare their assets. "Those who try to do so will be severely punished," he added. "The tax service will watch them closely."
Yeltsin said he had already filled in his own declaration, stating that his salary was lower than that of Russian bankers and businessmen.
"But I am not complaining. I live in an official flat, I have an official residence. But I have taken a small loan to build a small country home and I have bought a BMW car," he said.
